title: proud55
author: proud55
content: The two people who have helped me understand the rabbit hole more are Andreas Antonopoulos (@aantonop) and Matthew Kratter (@TraderUniversity).Want to create this post in celebration of both figures for providing clear and valuable Bitcoin Education for free on Youtube.Feel free to let me know your go-to figures for Bitcoin Education below -- I am open to learn more about Bitcoin. BTCBitcoin

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I have seen one or two videos by Andreas Antonopoulos, I personally liked the one addressing the topic about wallet security and the balance between accessibility and safety itself. Overall, I agreed with him that most of people should not exaggerate with ridiculous methods to secure their Bitcoin while risking future access.one needs to be reasonable and he gave some tips about it.Â  I have also watched some videos by Cryptobureau, but I am not sure what most people around here think of him, to be honest.

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: So far, Iâ€™ve come to realize that here on this forum, is the best place on where you could get the best bitcoin education. There are A LOT of knowledgeable people that knows and could teach you anything you would want to know about bitcoin. Iâ€™m fairly certain that on here, any question you may have would not go unanswered. So while Andreas Antonopoulos and Matthew Kratter may have enlightened you more on bitcoin, this forum has broadened my understanding and knowledge of bitcoin and has continued to do so on a daily basis.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: I don't really think I can recommend any other "figures". It's always been Andreas Antonopoulos, then various articles/videos made by numerous different people. When people ask me about learning material I simply send my personal copypasta lol. ðŸ‘‡* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chapters

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Andreas Antonopoulos is a great teacher,and knows how to do it in a professional way. I have also watched his video,it is good that you came to the forum, in this community whatever you need to know will be taught to you. I have learnt so much from this forum since I didn't even have a knowledge of bitcoin before I joined btt forummk4 has given you his own copypaste learning materials that will guide you through in bitcoin and if you need more don't hesitate to ask. Enjoy learning more and become a pro in the forum, if you care.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Learn Me a Bitcoin: https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Jameson Lopp: Bitcoin information and resources: https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information.htmlBitcoin.org Documentation: https://bitcoin.org/en/Youtube: Andreas M. Antonopoulos: https://www.youtube.com/user/aantonop. The channel has many playlists about Bitcoin. If you are newbie, you can watch playlists for Beginners.Security checklist

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: Quote from: proud55 on January 08, 2023, 12:02:45 AMThe two people who have helped me understand the rabbit hole more are Andreas Antonopoulos (@aantonop) and Matthew Kratter (@TraderUniversity).(....)Andreas Antonopoulos is the best example for me if you want to learn more about Bitcoin, and also if you take a look at Youtube videos by Andreas Antonopoulos and his books, it's all free.Another thing I can share, Andreas Antonopoulos is the OG of Bitcoin. Before this guy is already speaking about Bitcoin and there were few people listening to him, this is before when Bitcoin is still cheap and not popular, but this guy still continued.

comments.author: raybucks
comments.body: I suggest:1. binance everyone knows binance as a exchange or many people known binance has a learn and earn section where you can learn about crypto then complete a quiz test then earn in crypto2. coinmarketcap learn and earn here also you can learn and give quiz test then earn various crypto in your binance account3. this site(https://cryptodetail.com/) i found here on bitcointalk a person shared this is very good website to learn everything about crypto i really like it and everything is for free there a lot of other site on web but there are lot of ads4. If you want to pay and learn then you can try udemy, simpli learn,courseraÂ  etc. 5. youtube is very best

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: tbct_mt2 on January 08, 2023, 03:03:03 PMLearn Me a Bitcoin: https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Jameson Lopp: Bitcoin information and resources: https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information.htmlBitcoin.org Documentation: https://bitcoin.org/en/Youtube: Andreas M. Antonopoulos: https://www.youtube.com/user/aantonop. The channel has many playlists about Bitcoin. If you are newbie, you can watch playlists for Beginners.Security checklistCool, was'nt aware of the first links you shared - good resources to share with someone new to the space. Thanks.Regarding Andreas Antonopoulos: He was actually the guy that brought me into Bitcoin with his free educational videos. Incredible high quality content on the matter. Been recommending his stuff for years now.

comments.author: Oneandpure
comments.body: I am excited watching Youtube video channel from @Andreas Antonopoulos and he has new update about Bitcoin with bad or good news, actually his video explain clearly about Bitcoin and how newbie start investing and get educating about cryptocurrency. Good luck you have been understand about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency working after watching Youtube channel from @Andreas Antonopoulos and @Matthew Kratter.Keep make your research for next time when begin new trading in Bitcoin or altcoin, I think you have enough get more education from both Youtube channel and right now your profitable in cryptocurrency trading based on knowledge you have and not have following other Youtube channel.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: I like mk4's copypasta haha but yeah, I've always been an Andreas Antonopoulos fanboy. Have to admit I haven't heard his new stuff since 2021 at latest, so can't say but it was his books (collection of lectures) that really got me reading Bitcoin in 2016. Wish I'd found them earlier.Just something to mention... and I know we're only talking about Bitcoin but these days, my work takes me into a lot of learning in this area, and I've been really struggling to find a way to help a newcomer easily detach or expand on from Bitcoin education into "everything other than Bitcoin" learning. This mainly because the way Bitcoin works is almost completely different from everything else parading as "the same thing but better".From an education point of view, especially with kids and newcomers all using some form of non-Bitcoin wallet, now I try to see learning starting with Bitcoin and understanding classical crypto or classical blockchain (which is required fundamental) and then everything else is... modern crypto/blockchain (which is required for soon-to-be non-financial mainstream use).

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: There's nothing too bad in believing in people about what they say or taught about bitcoin but we must be mindful that this same people can change over time and many factors could have led to their change even beyond they'd expected and this makes the fact that if i must trust anything that has to do with bitcoin then it must first comes from the the official forum here which is the main purpose why Satoshi created this, to engaged all bitcoiners across the world to discussion about the network, am not against Andreas Antonopoulos but let's assume they can later be influenced to change or misinformation whereas the forum here cannot.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: When it comes to Bitcoin learning video content, Andreas Antonopoulos is a great source of Bitcoin education, even e-books that wrote him are very worth it to read and it's inspired us to learn.Â  There are a lot of sources dropped above and that's enough information for you to start to learn about Bitcoin also, this forum can be your source too upon studying Bitcoin. Before when I want to explore Bitcoin, I choose the Bitcoin.org website because I know most of my question was answered by them.Start your journey now by reading informative books or articles made by an expert who has more knowledge on Bitcoin.

comments.author: mvdheuvel1983
comments.body: Quote from: proud55 on January 08, 2023, 12:02:45 AMThe two people who have helped me understand the rabbit hole more are Andreas Antonopoulos (@aantonop) and Matthew Kratter (@TraderUniversity).Want to create this post in celebration of both figures for providing clear and valuable Bitcoin Education for free on Youtube.Feel free to let me know your go-to figures for Bitcoin Education below -- I am open to learn more about Bitcoin. BTCBitcoinOh, Mr Andreas makes easily one of the best crypto educators out there. He explains crypto concepts so well that can get it the first time you listen to him or read his books.In fact, one his best quotes that got me curious about him was in his book The Internet of Money Volume Three: A collection of talks by Andreas M. Antonopoulos. He said, every time you use crypto, you are exercising sovereign power that is diverting money from a corrupt and broken system of central banks, investment banks, and governments, into a system that is giving people hope.I haven't really heard of Matthew Kratter. I just check him out on his YouTube channel and I can see why the OP listed him. Fabulous.

comments.author: Fuso.hp
comments.body: While other topics are highlighted in various social media, the education related to Bitcoin is relatively less highlighted. All the channels that upload Bitcoin related videos get very few views. As a result, those who work tirelessly and want to share some knowledge about Bitcoin with others, they stop uploading these Bitcoin related videos, seeing that everyone is less interested. That's why there are so few Bitcoin-related educations available on various social media today.Â  However, there are some channels that regularly post educational videos related to Bitcoin.

comments.author: speedy963
comments.body: Quote from: GreatArkansas on January 08, 2023, 03:23:29 PMQuote from: proud55 on January 08, 2023, 12:02:45 AMThe two people who have helped me understand the rabbit hole more are Andreas Antonopoulos (@aantonop) and Matthew Kratter (@TraderUniversity).(....)Andreas Antonopoulos is the best example for me if you want to learn more about Bitcoin, and also if you take a look at Youtube videos by Andreas Antonopoulos and his books, it's all free.Another thing I can share, Andreas Antonopoulos is the OG of Bitcoin. Before this guy is already speaking about Bitcoin and there were few people listening to him, this is before when Bitcoin is still cheap and not popular, but this guy still continued.I have heard of his name way back and I remembered watching some of his educational clips back then, but after I encounter this forum I immediately switch my focus here since here nobody's going to coach you one-on-one, but instead you need to figure it out on your own. You can ask questions and they provide hints or step-by-step process.I do learned a couple from his videos, but I do prefer it here since there is no "spoonfeeding" on this forum, and if you want to learn, you should do your own thing and explore.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: I don't think there's a good speaker who talk about Bitcoin compared to Andreas Antonopoulos, the other are only interested to talk about to make money and their stupid prediction. If you've read the books created by Andreas Antonopoulos or watch most of his videos, I think you're already have an enough knowledge about Bitcoin. Maybe you can start to conversation with the other user in this forum and read other user post too.

comments.author: MusaPk
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on January 08, 2023, 08:25:06 AMI don't really think I can recommend any other "figures". It's always been Andreas Antonopoulos, then various articles/videos made by numerous different people. When people ask me about learning material I simply send my personal copypasta lol. ðŸ‘‡* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chaptersThere is consent that 'Andreas Antonopoulos' is one of the best speaker of bitcoin though there are other people also that can give you good info about bitcoin like 'Michael Saylor'.You have already some great learning material, I would say anyone learning about Bitcoin must start from the bitcoin whitepaper produced by founder of Bitcoin Satoshi Nakamoto https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf . The whitepaper is very easy to understand as it doesn't have too much underlying technical details.
